original_title: Fuel supplying contracts in 10 airports for SriLankan aircraft
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The government has awarded contracts to supply aviation fuel for SriLankan aircraft at 9 international airports.
The contracts of supplying aviation fuel for aircraft at the Bangkok, Beijing, Dubai, Hyderabad, Karachi, Male and Riyadh airports will end on February 29, 2024.
The contracts at Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta airports end on March 31, 2024.
Sri Lanka had called for international competitive bids to supply fuel at these airports.

“Bids have been furnished by 11 aircraft fuel supplying companies: one bid for Karachi airport and two or more bids to the other eight airports,” cabinet spokesman minister Bandula Gunawardena said at a press briefing announcing cabinet decisions for the week on Tuesday (12).

“Accordingly, the Cabinet granted approval to the proposal submitted by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Services to award the said contracts to the bidders who substantially responded and submitted minimum quotations as per the recommendations of the Standing Procurement Committee appointed by the cabinet.”

The contract for supplying aviation fuel at Dammam airport is to end this year. Quotations from the only aircraft fuel supplier available there, Modern Consortium for Refueling Aircraft Co Ltd (MCRA) were called, and the contract was awarded as a direct contract. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
